TypeSignature.Value: Public Interface IResultSetMetaData Implements IDisposable, IJavaPeerable, IWrapper
public interface class IResultSetMetaData : IDisposable, Java::Interop::IJavaPeerable, Java::Sql::IWrapper
public interface IResultSetMetaData : IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.Sql.IWrapper

.class public interface auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IResultSetMetaData implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.Sql.IWrapper, class System.IDisposable
type IResultSetMetaData = interface interface IWrapper interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: An object that can be used to get information about the types and properties of the columns in a ResultSet object.

remarks.para: An object that can be used to get information about the types and properties of the columns in a ResultSet object. The following code fragment creates the ResultSet object rs, creates the ResultSetMetaData object rsmd, and uses rsmd to find out how many columns rs has and whether the first column in rs can be used in a WHERE clause.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetCatalogName(int32 column) cil managed

Docs.param: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
Docs.summary: Gets the designated column's table's catalog name.
Docs.returns: the name of the catalog for the table in which the given column appears or "" if not applicable

remarks.para: Gets the designated column's table's catalog name.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GetColumnClassName (column As Integer) As String
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetColumnClassName(int32 column) cil managed

Docs.param: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
Docs.summary: Returns the fully-qualified name of the Java class whose instances are manufactured if the method ResultSet.getObject is called to retrieve a value from the column.
Docs.returns: the fully-qualified name of the class in the Java programming language that would be used by the method ResultSet.getObject to retrieve the value in the specified column. This is the class name used for custom mapping.

remarks.para: Returns the fully-qualified name of the Java class whose instances are manufactured if the method ResultSet.getObject is called to retrieve a value from the column. ResultSet.getObject may return a subclass of the class returned by this method.
Added in 1.2.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if there is a database error.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GetColumnLabel (column As Integer) As String
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetColumnLabel(int32 column) cil managed

Docs.param: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
Docs.summary: Gets the designated column's suggested title for use in printouts and displays.

remarks.para: Gets the designated column's suggested title for use in printouts and displays. The suggested title is usually specified by the SQL AS clause. If a SQL AS is not specified, the value returned from getColumnLabel will be the same as the value returned by the getColumnName method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if there is a database error.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GetPrecision (column As Integer) As Integer
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetPrecision(int32 column) cil managed

Docs.param: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
Docs.summary: Get the designated column's specified column size.

remarks.para: Get the designated column's specified column size. For numeric data, this is the maximum precision. For character data, this is the length in characters. For datetime datatypes, this is the length in characters of the String representation (assuming the maximum allowed precision of the fractional seconds component). For binary data, this is the length in bytes. For the ROWID datatype, this is the length in bytes. 0 is returned for data types where the column size is not applicable.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if there is a database error.

Docs.param: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
Docs.summary: Gets the designated column's number of digits to right of the decimal point.

remarks.para: Gets the designated column's number of digits to right of the decimal point. 0 is returned for data types where the scale is not applicable.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
